Recap: Vincent tells Cristian that he is done as a boxer now that the commission has made its decision. He is a businessman and needs to make money, so he releases Cristian from his contract. Cristian vows to clear his name. Vincent hopes that he does just that. Natalie goes to her parents' place and they all crowd around her and offer her a shoulder should she need it. She realizes that she doesn't really need as much space as she thought. Todd finds Cristian and Evangeline in the park and Evangeline thanks him for the favorable article that he wrote about Todd in his paper. "You know, those people who bet against you made a lot of money I know that I did " Shaun has been friends with Vincent for many years. He feels that Vincent knows as well as he does that Cristian was set up. "You should know," Todd says appearing at the table suddenly. "You set him up!" Shaun gets in Todd's face and is ready to throw him out of the restaurant. Todd tells Vincent that he overheard Ted talking and that he knows that the fight was fixed. "Get me some coffee and a muffin and I will tell you all about it." Rex has a minute alone with Adriana and tries to get her into bed. She stops him, trying to make sure first that he understands that she wants to get to know 'Adriana' alone first, and then 'Rex and Adriana' will come into play later. Natalie tells her family how John was going to propose to her and she shows them the ring. Todd wants to know if Vincent profited from Cristian getting set up but there isn't time to answer as Layla appears. She tells Vincent of Hugh being in the accident and getting hurt. Vincent is upset hearing the news. "Yeah, I hear that he is burned to a crisp." Layla finds his comment unwarranted. Vincent makes a comment about John as if he doesn't care about him being killed, Todd warns him not to talk like that about McBain! Starr and Langston are in the halls. Britney and her posse bump into Starr and Langston on purpose. They have a shouting match. Langston and Starr see the girls talking to some cute guys and when the girls clear out, Langston and Starr go to meet the guys. They get invited to a party that is going to be wild, and Starr beams. "I love doing 'wild.'" The girls rush out giggling and Langston has to ask if Starr will really get wild at the party. "Why shouldn't I? I deserve to more than anyone else!"
Transcript: Cristian: Thinking about John?
Evangeline: The idea that he's gone, it -- doesn't seem real to me.
Cristian: Look, it just happened. Don't put so much pressure on yourself to handle it. Nobody expects that, you know? What are you doing?
Evangeline: I'm going to check in on Natalie --
Cristian: What?
Evangeline: Michael --
Cristian: You're not listening.
Evangeline: What, Cris?
Cristian: Would you think about yourself for once? Just give it time, you know, take a deep breath, let it sink in.
Evangeline: Why do you want to go to the diner and have breakfast with your mom?
Cristian: I just can't take her going off about how unfair the boxing commission is, how she knows I would never take a dive, how they should let me defend myself.
Evangeline: Well, she's being your mom. She's taking care of you.

Cristian: Yeah, but my family doesn't need that kind of negative attention, not again. I'm going to fix this. I'm going to find a way to get back in the ring again. I want that title. I'm going to get it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Vincent: It's a great sound bite. Too bad it's just talk. Your boxing career is over, Vega.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jessica: Is Natalie's phone still off?
Viki: It just goes directly to voicemail. I wish she had called last night.
Clint: Well, it probably didn't even occur to her, Viki. She's been basically living at John's for quite a while now.
Viki: Yes, but, Clint, John is gone now. And she should not be alone. We really need to find her.
Natalie: I'm right here.

Starr: Dad, are you really going to walk us all the way to the classroom?
Todd: Why, Starr? Are you embarrassed to be seen with your old man?
Langston: Are you kidding? You're so the hot topic right now. Definitely adds to our street cred.
Starr: Yeah, a little too much.
Langston: Thanks for the ride, Mr. Manning. You should've seen the look on their faces when we got out of your sports car -- green with envy.
Starr: Dad? I love you, but could you please go now?
Todd: No. Mrs. Kowalski wants to see me before class.
Starr: Just you without mom?
Todd: Guess so.
Starr: Why didn't you tell me about it?
Todd: Why do you need to know? Are you in some kind of trouble?

Adriana: Rex, Rex, Rex, Rex. Oh, wait -- these are cashmere.

Layla: Oh, I took a personal day and my paid vacation so I can start looking for a new job.

Adriana: I hear you. I quit "Craze."
Layla: What about modeling?
Adriana: Hmm. I don't think I want to do that anymore. All those people staring at me, it just feels like everybody's a potential stalker.
Layla: Don't worry -- you're not a creep magnet. Your mother hired that guy.
Adriana: I know it doesn't make any sense, but I can't help it. I'm just a nervous wreck these days.
Rex: Oh. You could work at U.V. if you want. bartending, hostessing. If you want jobs, they're yours.

Viki: Oh, Natalie. Oh. You ok?

Clint: Natalie.
Natalie: Hey, dad.
Clint: Oh, I love you, honey. Can I get you anything, coffee or something?
Natalie: No, thanks.
Viki: Natalie, sweetheart, I want you to know that this will always be home for you, ok?
Natalie: Thanks. I know, I just -- I really didn't know where else to go right now.

Natalie: I'm not hungry.
Jessica: Breakfast isn't going to help, nothing is. I mean, John's dead.

Starr: Dad, no, I'm not in trouble. Why would I be? School's barely even started.

Starr: Then why would you invite my parents?

Mrs. Kowalski: Yes. I'm sure it would be very illuminating.
Todd: Well, I think high school's harrowing enough, don't you?
Mrs. Kowalski: Huh
Todd: Uh -- no. I appreciate the offer, but I just think it's something that the kids don't need to hear about at this age.
Mrs. Kowalski: Oh. Oh, ok, all right. I understand. I'm disappointed, but I certainly understand. Shall we go inside, ladies?
Starr: Hmm.
Todd: Have a good day, ladies.

Vincent: Vega? Seriously, man, look at it. Do you want to wind up painting with your teeth? Come on, man. Do something else with yourself.
Cristian: I had endorsement deals lined up, Vincent. Sponsors were calling me. This was supposed to be my ticket.
Vincent: Well, your ticket's been punched. You have the stench of a cheater now.
Cristian: You're not listening. I was going to use that money to buy a gym. I was thinking of buying Rourke's, actually.

Cristian: Hey, not -- nobody's going to want to train with a guy who took a dive.

Vincent: So what do you want to do? Tell me -- what do you want to do? The boxing commission already examined Abbott's gloves. They found nothing. I'm going to have to cut my losses.
Cristian: Well, wait a minute -- what is that supposed to mean?
Vincent: I'm a businessman, Vega, and you know that. And you're no longer a marketable commodity, so consider our contract dissolved.
Cristian: Ok, fine. Then I'll have to clear my name on my own.
Vincent: I hope you do.

Natalie: Can you bring John back?
Kelly: No. I wish I could.
Clint: You know, sweetheart, we loved John because you loved him. I want you to know that you're not alone, and we're here to help you. Let us shoulder some of the hurt.

Kelly: You think you can?
